description: Let p(i) = i-th prime (A000040), let d(i) = p(i+1)-p(i) (A001223); a(n) = number of distinct numbers among d(n), d(n+1), d(n+2), ... before first duplicate is encountered.
example: The d sequence starting at p(7) = 17 is d(7) = 2, d(8) = 4, d(9) = 6, d(10) = 2, with three numbers before the first duplication, so a(7) = 3.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{k = 1}, While[p = Table[ Prime[i], {i, n, n + k}]; Length[ Union[ Drop[p, 1] - Drop[p, -1]]] == k, k++ ]; k - 1]; Table[ f[n], {n, 1, 105}]
crossrefs: A078515 gives RECORDS transform of this sequence. See also A079007.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 07 2003
extensions: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 07 2002
